result.execSummary:
The defendant Devin M. Bowman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Def to report to the DOC in Ashland immediately upon release from custody.
  While on supervision the Def is to pay their financial obligations through the Clerk of Court, which may include payments on restitution, fines, costs, surcharges, etc that are court ordered.
The payments are to be paid directly to the Clerk of Court Office at:
Ashland Co Clerk of Circuit Court
201 Main Street West - Room 307
Ashland, WI  54806
  All financial obligations paid through the Clerk of Courts office are subject to civil judgment and certification to the Department of Revenue on any balance owed after 60 days from entry of judgment.

miscConds.notes: All financial obligations added to payment plan.

Upon successful completion of the terms/conditions of this sentence (including payment of all financial obligations) and supervision followed with a letter confirming successful completion from DOC, this record would be expunged!

Defendant shall not possess/consume alcoholic beverages, illegal drugs, drug paraphernalia or any mind altering substances (MAS).  MAS means alcoholic beverages, controlled substances other than those prescribed by treating physician to the Def & taken only as prescribed, inhalants, synthetic marijuana or a similar substance, and/or over-the-counter medications used contrary to label instructions.  THE DEFENDANT IS TO MAINTAIN ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
The Defendant shall not enter any bars, taverns, liquor stores (any place where the primary purpose is the sale of alcohol) where mind altering substances are possessed or consumed EXCEPT for employment at the casino or restaurant.
  Not to associate with any known drug users or those involved in trafficking, other than in a professional group counseling setting,meeting, or in a correctional setting.
  Any contraband seized to be forfeited!
  The Def is subject to random UA testing.
  The Def is to provide a DNA specimen at the Ashland County Jail.
NO CONTACT with Cody Stone
NO CONTACT with Tyler Anglin
NO CONTACT with Christopher Boyd
Undergo alcohol/drug assessment and complete recommended treatment-responsible for finding the funding for any treatment/counseling recommended.
